text: I have data from a survey, interviews and focus groups of almost 300 farmers where 90% indicated they are NOT willing to pay towards advice which is currently free at the point of delivery. Time to get some of that data published I think! @EnvAgency @NFUtweets @FarmersWeekly https://t.co/RopsokkzPV

@vivianne005 @ConnorPR @EnvAgency @ShropCouncil @FloodForum @FloodArkLimited @FloodArk Neighbours who live near us on Underdale Rd are also adamant that levels down here were nowhere near as high in 2000 when Welsh Bridge level was higher. Something‚Äôs not right. Flood defences pushing the problem further downstream??

@vivianne005 @ConnorPR @EnvAgency @ShropCouncil @FloodForum @FloodArkLimited @FloodArk We now have to wait for different consultants to come back to us for quotes on work. Could have avoided being flooded again had we carried out work that our consultant recommended 10 months ago!

@vivianne005 @ConnorPR @EnvAgency @ShropCouncil @FloodForum @FloodArkLimited @FloodArk The PFR scheme is strangled by red tape. We were making good progress with a consultant recommended by @floodmary last March but were unable to use them because rules limited us to 2 consultants for the survey, reduced to 1 through lack of resource.
